article.title: How to translate the MMC web interface
article.subtitle: Informational / Draft

abstract.para: This document explains how to help the MDS project to make the MMC support more languages

section.title: Introduction
section.para: You don't need to be a programmer to do some translation works.
Please subscribe to the MDS i18n mailing list, and tell us about the language you want to work on (somebody else may already translates this language).

section.title: How to translate the MMC
section.para: The MMC web interface uses the PHP gettext library to provide a multilanguage experience.
Please note that gettext requires the locales you want to use to be installed on your system. For example, to have the french locale working, you must install the "fr_FR.UTF-8" locale.
If you want to do some translation works:

listitem.para: Tell us you want to do it ;
Export the SVN repository of the interface part you want to translate ;
Rebuild the template file that contains all the translation ;
Translate the po file with a dedicated application (kbabel, poedit ...) ;
Test it, and send us the translated file (.po file).

section.para: For example, you want to translate mmc-web-base into Spanish:
section.screen: $ cd /tmp $ svn export http://mds.mandriva.org/svn/mmc-web-base/trunk $ cd trunk $ make build_pot # Will build the translation template $ mkdir -p modules/base/locale/es_ES/LC_MESSAGES $ cp modules/base/locale/base.pot modules/base/locale/es_ES/LC_MESSAGES/base.po # use your favorite editor to translate modules/base/locale/es_ES/LC_MESSAGES/base.po $ kbabel modules/base/locale/es_ES/LC_MESSAGES/base.po # Compile the .mo file and copy it to your running MMC $ make build_mo $ cp -r modules/base/locale/es_ES /usr/share/mmc/modules/base/locale # Install the spanish es_ES.UTF-8 on your system # Your apache2 must be restarted to use the new .mo file $ /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
section.para: Now if you point your navigator to the MMC login page, your newly translated language should be available.
